segment.source: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.
segment.target: Data binding is a way for your app's UI to display data, and optionally to stay in sync with that data.

segment.source: Data binding allows you to separate the concern of data from the concern of UI, and that results in a simpler conceptual model as well as better readability, testability, and maintainability of your app.
segment.target: Data binding allows you to separate the concern of data from the concern of UI, and that results in a simpler conceptual model as well as better readability, testability, and maintainability of your app.

segment.source: In markup, you can choose to use either the {x:Bind} markup extension or the {Binding} markup extension.
segment.target: In markup, you can choose to use either the {x:Bind} markup extension or the {Binding} markup extension.

segment.source: And you can even use a mixture of the two in the same app—even on the same UI element.
segment.target: And you can even use a mixture of the two in the same app—even on the same UI element.

segment.source: Data binding overview
segment.target: Data binding overview

segment.source: This topic shows you how to bind a control (or other UI element) to a single item or bind an items control to a collection of items in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: This topic shows you how to bind a control (or other UI element) to a single item or bind an items control to a collection of items in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: In addition, we show how to control the rendering of items, implement a details view based on a selection, and convert data for display.
segment.target: In addition, we show how to control the rendering of items, implement a details view based on a selection, and convert data for display.

segment.source: For more detailed info, see Data binding in depth.
segment.target: For more detailed info, see Data binding in depth.

segment.source: Sample data on the design surface, and for prototyping
segment.target: Sample data on the design surface, and for prototyping

segment.source: It may be impossible or undesirable (perhaps for reasons of privacy or performance) for your app to display live data on the design surface in Microsoft Visual Studio or Blend for Visual Studio.
segment.target: It may be impossible or undesirable (perhaps for reasons of privacy or performance) for your app to display live data on the design surface in Microsoft Visual Studio or Blend for Visual Studio.

segment.source: In order to have your controls populated with data (so that you can work on your app's layout, templates, and other visual properties), there are various ways in which you can use design-time sample data.
segment.target: In order to have your controls populated with data (so that you can work on your app's layout, templates, and other visual properties), there are various ways in which you can use design-time sample data.

segment.source: Sample data can also be really useful and time-saving if you're building a sketch (or prototype) app.
segment.target: Sample data can also be really useful and time-saving if you're building a sketch (or prototype) app.

segment.source: You can use sample data in your sketch or prototype at run-time to illustrate your ideas without going as far as connecting to real, live data.
segment.target: You can use sample data in your sketch or prototype at run-time to illustrate your ideas without going as far as connecting to real, live data.

segment.source: Bind hierarchical data and create a master/details view
segment.target: Bind hierarchical data and create a master/details view

segment.source: You can make a multi-level master/details (also known as list-details) view of hierarchical data by binding items controls to CollectionViewSource instances that are bound together in a chain.
segment.target: You can make a multi-level master/details (also known as list-details) view of hierarchical data by binding items controls to CollectionViewSource instances that are bound together in a chain.
